qas.question: Why were the Chamorros brought to Guam?
How were Guamanian Chamorro viewed by the Japanese?
How Northern Chamorro view Guamanian Chamorro?
For how many years did Japan occupy Guam?
For how many years before the war had the Northern Mariana Islands been a Japanese protectorate?
Who were the Guamanian Chamorro loyal to?
With what attitude did the Northern Chamorro treat the Guamanian Chamorro during the occupation?

context: The Northern Mariana Islands had become a Japanese protectorate before the war. It was the Chamorros from the Northern Marianas who were brought to Guam <a0_0>to serve as interpreters<a0_0/> and in other capacities for the occupying Japanese force. The Guamanian Chamorros were treated <a1_0>as an occupied <b3_0>enemy<b3_0/><a1_0/> by the Japanese military. After the war, this would cause resentment between the Guamanian Chamorros and the Chamorros of the Northern Marianas. Guam's Chamorros believed their northern brethren should have been <b7_0>compassionate<b7_0/> towards them, whereas having been occupied for over <b4_0><b5_0>30<b5_0/><b4_0/> years, the <a2_0>Northern Mariana Chamorros<a2_0/> were loyal to <b6_0>Japan<b6_0/>.
